[Packages](/docs/apis/) &gt; [@fluid-tools/api-markdown-documenter](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter)

Contains a programatic API for generating [Markdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) documentation from an API report generated by [API-Extractor](https://api-extractor.com/).

## Remarks {#_fluid-tools_api-markdown-documenter-remarks}

Akin to [API-Documenter](https://github.com/microsoft/rushstack/tree/main/apps/api-documenter) and is heavily based upon it, but is designed to be more extensible and to be be used programatically.

      </td>
      <td>
        List of item kinds for which separate documents should be generated. Items specified will be rendered to their own documents. Items not specified will be rendered into their parent's contents.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#hierarchyboundaries-typealias'>HierarchyBoundaries</a>
      </td>
      <td>
        List of item kinds for which sub-directories will be generated, and under which child item documents will be created. If not specified for an item kind, any children of items of that kind will be generated adjacent to the parent.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#loggingfunction-typealias'>LoggingFunction</a>

      </td>

      <td>

      </td>
      <td>
        Signature for a function which generates one or more <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/sectionnode-class'>SectionNode</a>s describing an API item that potentially has child items to be rendered as content under it.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#transformapiitemwithoutchildren-typealias'>TransformApiItemWithoutChildren</a>
      </td>
      <td>
        Signature for a function which generates one or more <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/sectionnode-class'>SectionNode</a>s describing an API item that *does not* have child items to be rendered.

```typescript
Sealed = "sealed"
```

### DocumentationNodeType {#documentationnodetype-enum}

Kinds of [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface) known inherently by the system.

#### Signature {#documentationnodetype-signature}

```typescript
export declare enum DocumentationNodeType
```

#### Remarks {#documentationnodetype-remarks}

Any given [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface) implementation will specify a unique value as its [type](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface#type-propertysignature).

## Type Details

### ApiFunctionLike {#apifunctionlike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing function-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apifunctionlike-signature}

```typescript
export type ApiFunctionLike = ApiConstructSignature | ApiConstructor | ApiFunction | ApiMethod | ApiMethodSignature;
```

### ApiMemberKind {#apimemberkind-typealias}

Represents "member" API item kinds. These are the kinds of items the system supports generally for rendering, file-system configuration, etc.

#### Signature {#apimemberkind-signature}

```typescript
export type ApiMemberKind = Omit<ApiItemKind, ApiItemKind.EntryPoint | ApiItemKind.Model | ApiItemKind.None | ApiItemKind.Package>;
```

#### Remarks {#apimemberkind-remarks}

This type explicitly excludes the following API item kinds represented in API-Extractor models:

- `None`

- `EntryPoint`

- `Model`

- `Package`

### ApiModuleLike {#apimodulelike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing module-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apimodulelike-signature}

```typescript
export type ApiModuleLike = ApiEntryPoint | ApiNamespace;
```

### ApiSignatureLike {#apisignaturelike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing call-signature-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apisignaturelike-signature}

```typescript
export type ApiSignatureLike = ApiCallSignature | ApiIndexSignature;
```

### CreateChildContentSections {#createchildcontentsections-typealias}

Signature for a function which generates information about an API item with inner content injected into the same section.

#### Signature {#createchildcontentsections-signature}

```typescript
export type CreateChildContentSections = (apiItem: ApiItem, childSections: SectionNode[] | undefined, config: Required<ApiItemTransformationConfiguration>) => SectionNode[];
```

### DocumentBoundaries {#documentboundaries-typealias}

List of item kinds for which separate documents should be generated. Items specified will be rendered to their own documents. Items not specified will be rendered into their parent's contents.

#### Signature {#documentboundaries-signature}

```typescript
export type DocumentBoundaries = ApiMemberKind[];
```

#### Remarks {#documentboundaries-remarks}

Note that `Model` and `Package` items will \*always\* have separate documents generated for them, even if not specified.

Also note that `EntryPoint` items will always be ignored by the system, even if specified here.

#### Example {#documentboundaries-example}

A configuration like the following:

```typescript
...
documentBoundaries: [
 ApiItemKind.Namespace,
],
...
```

will result in separate documents being generated for `Namespace` items, but will not for other item kinds (`Classes`, `Interfaces`, etc.).

### HierarchyBoundaries {#hierarchyboundaries-typealias}

List of item kinds for which sub-directories will be generated, and under which child item documents will be created. If not specified for an item kind, any children of items of that kind will be generated adjacent to the parent.

#### Signature {#hierarchyboundaries-signature}

```typescript
export type HierarchyBoundaries = ApiMemberKind[];
```

#### Remarks {#hierarchyboundaries-remarks}

Note that `Package` items will \*always\* have separate documents generated for them, even if not specified.

#### Example {#hierarchyboundaries-example}

A configuration like the following:

```typescript
...
hierarchyBoundaries: [
 ApiItemKind.Namespace,
],
...
```

will result in documents rendered for children of the `Namespace` to be generated in a subdirectory named after the `Namespace` item.

So for some namespace `Foo` with children `Bar` and `Baz` (assuming `Bar` and `Baz` are item kinds matching the configured [documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature)), the resulting file structure would look like the following:

```
foo.md
foo
 | bar.md
 | baz.md
```

### LoggingFunction {#loggingfunction-typealias}

Function signature for logging a message or error.

#### Signature {#loggingfunction-signature}

```typescript
export type LoggingFunction = (message: string | Error, ...args: unknown[]) => void;
```

### RenderDocumentationNodeAsMarkdown {#renderdocumentationnodeasmarkdown-typealias}

```typescript
export type RenderDocumentationNode<TDocumentationNode extends DocumentationNode = DocumentationNode> = (node: TDocumentationNode, writer: DocumentWriter, context: MarkdownRenderContext) => void;
```

### TransformApiItemWithChildren {#transformapiitemwithchildren-typealias}

Signature for a function which generates one or more [SectionNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/sectionnode-class)s describing an API item that potentially has child items to be rendered as content under it.

#### Signature {#transformapiitemwithchildren-signature}

```typescript
export type TransformApiItemWithChildren<TApiItem extends ApiItem> = (apiItem: TApiItem, config: Required<ApiItemTransformationConfiguration>, generateChildSection: (apiItem: ApiItem) => SectionNode[]) => SectionNode[];
```

### TransformApiItemWithoutChildren {#transformapiitemwithoutchildren-typealias}

Signature for a function which generates one or more [SectionNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/sectionnode-class)s describing an API item that \*does not\* have child items to be rendered.

#### Signature {#transformapiitemwithoutchildren-signature}

```typescript
export type TransformApiItemWithoutChildren<TApiItem extends ApiItem> = (apiItem: TApiItem, config: Required<ApiItemTransformationConfiguration>) => SectionNode[];
```

### getFilePathForApiItem {#getfilepathforapiitem-function}

Gets the file path for the specified API item.

#### Signature {#getfilepathforapiitem-signature}

```typescript
export declare function getFilePathForApiItem(apiItem: ApiItem, config: Required<ApiItemTransformationConfiguration>): string;
```

#### Remarks {#getfilepathforapiitem-remarks}

In the case of an item that does not get rendered to its own document, this will point to the document of the ancestor item under which the provided item will be rendered.

The generated path is relative to [uriRoot](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/apiitemtransformationconfiguration-interface#uriroot-propertysignature).

      </td>

    <tr>
      <td>

      <td>

### loadModel {#loadmodel-function}

Reads API reports generated by [API-Extractor](https://api-extractor.com/) (.api.json files) under the provided directory path, and generates an `ApiModel` from them.

#### Signature {#loadmodel-signature}

```typescript
export declare function loadModel(reportsDirectoryPath: string, logger?: Logger): Promise<ApiModel>;
```

#### Remarks {#loadmodel-remarks}

The resulting `ApiModel` can be passed to [transformApiModel](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#transformapimodel-function) or [renderApiModelAsMarkdown](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#renderapimodelasmarkdown-function) to generate API documentation for the model and its packages.

#### Parameters {#loadmodel-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th>
        Modifiers
      </th>
      <th>
        Type
      </th>
      <th>
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        reportsDirectoryPath
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
      <td>
        <span>string</span>
      </td>
      <td>
        Path to the directory containing the API reports.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        logger
      </td>
      <td>
        optional
      </td>
      <td>
        <span><a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/logger-interface'>Logger</a></span>
      </td>
      <td>
        Optional logger for reporting system events while loading the model.
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#loadmodel-returns}

**Return type:** Promise&lt;ApiModel&gt;

### renderApiModelAsMarkdown {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-function}

Renders the provided model and its contents, and writes each document to a file on disk.

#### Signature {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-signature}

```typescript
export declare function renderApiModelAsMarkdown(transformConfig: ApiItemTransformationConfiguration, renderConfig: MarkdownRenderConfiguration, outputDirectoryPath: string): Promise<void>;
```

#### Remarks {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-remarks}

Which API members get their own documents and which get written to the contents of their parent is determined by [documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature).

The file paths under which the files will be generated is determined by the provided output path and the following configuration properties:

- [documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature) - [hierarchyBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#hierarchyboundaries-propertysignature)

#### Parameters {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th>
        Type
      </th>
      <th>
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        transformConfig
      </td>
      <td>
        <span><a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/apiitemtransformationconfiguration-interface'>ApiItemTransformationConfiguration</a></span>
      </td>
      <td>
        Configuration for transforming API items into <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface'>DocumentationNode</a>s.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        renderConfig
      </td>
      <td>
        <span><a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/markdownrenderconfiguration-interface'>MarkdownRenderConfiguration</a></span>
      </td>
      <td>
        Configuration for rendering <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentnode-class'>DocumentNode</a>s as Markdown.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        outputDirectoryPath
      </td>
      <td>
        <span>string</span>
      </td>
      <td>
        The directory under which the document files will be generated.
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-returns}

**Return type:** Promise&lt;void&gt;

### renderDocumentAsMarkdown {#renderdocumentasmarkdown-function}

### transformApiModel {#transformapimodel-function}

Renders the provided model and its contents to a series of [DocumentNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentnode-class)s.

#### Signature {#transformapimodel-signature}

```typescript
export declare function transformApiModel(transformConfig: ApiItemTransformationConfiguration): DocumentNode[];
```

#### Remarks {#transformapimodel-remarks}

Which API members get their own documents and which get written to the contents of their parent is determined by [documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature).

The generated nodes' [filePath](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentnode-class#filepath-property)s are determined by the provided output path and the following configuration properties:

- [documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature) - [hierarchyBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface#hierarchyboundaries-propertysignature)

#### Parameters {#transformapimodel-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th>
        Type
      </th>
      <th>
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        transformConfig
      </td>
      <td>
        <span><a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/apiitemtransformationconfiguration-interface'>ApiItemTransformationConfiguration</a></span>
      </td>
      <td>
        Configuration for transforming API items into <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface'>DocumentationNode</a>s.
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#transformapimodel-returns}

**Return type:** [DocumentNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentnode-class)\[\]

### transformDocNode {#transformdocnode-function}

Converts a [DocNode](https://github.com/microsoft/tsdoc/blob/main/tsdoc/src/nodes/DocNode.ts) to a [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface).

#### Signature {#transformdocnode-signature}

```typescript
export declare function transformDocNode(docNode: DocNode, contextApiItem: ApiItem, config: Required<ApiItemTransformationConfiguration>): DocumentationNode | undefined;
```

#### Remarks {#transformdocnode-remarks}

The set of supported `DocNode` kinds here is based on what appears in `ApiItem`s generated by API-Extractor. This set may need to be updated if/when API-Extractor changes its output format.

#### Parameters {#transformdocnode-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th>
        Type
      </th>
      <th>
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        docNode
      </td>
      <td>
        <span>DocNode</span>
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        contextApiItem
      </td>
      <td>
        <span>ApiItem</span>
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        config
      </td>
      <td>
        <span>Required&lt;<a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/apiitemtransformationconfiguration-interface'>ApiItemTransformationConfiguration</a>&gt;</span>
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#transformdocnode-returns}

The transformed `DocNode`, if it was of a kind we support. Else, an error will be logged, and `undefined` will be returned.

**Return type:** [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationnode-interface) \| undefined

## Variable Details

### defaultConsoleLogger {#defaultconsolelogger-variable}

Default logger, configured to log to the console.

#### Signature {#defaultconsolelogger-signature}

```typescript
defaultConsoleLogger: Logger
```

### verboseConsoleLogger {#verboseconsolelogger-variable}

Verbose logger, configured to log to the console.

#### Signature {#verboseconsolelogger-signature}

```typescript
verboseConsoleLogger: Logger
```
